business.headline: Is it the end of the road for silver after a spectacular rally?After a stunning rally and an equally sharp fall, silver now sits at a crucial crossroads, leaving investors wondering whether this correction is nearing its end or still gathering momentum.

Sensex tumbles over 800 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 9:39 am, the Sensex was at 82,840.72, down 834.20 points, while the Nifty stood at 25,536.30, lower by 270.90 points. The fall was led by heavy selling in IT stocks, but the triggers lie largely in global developments.

TCS, Infosys sink nearly 6%: 3 reasons why IT stocks are falling againShares of TCS and Infosys fell nearly 6% in early trade, dragging the Nifty IT index lower. The weakness was not driven by any one company-specific announcement. Instead, it reflects a mix of global triggers and rising uncertainty around how artificial intelligence will reshape the industry.

Sensex drops 700 points as AI panic hits IT stocks; Infosys, TCS drop 5%The Sensex fell over 700 points in early trade, while the Nifty slipped below the 25,600 mark. The decline was led by frontline technology majors such as Infosys and TCS, along with other large-cap IT names.

Retail inflation at 2.75% in January as India shifts to new CPI base year 2024The data, released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation, reflects a major statistical overhaul aimed at making India's inflation measure more representative of current consumption patterns.

A 90-year-old man was sold a 100-year policy. Why blaming the bank is not enoughHandcrafted ByOur Editors A 90-year-old man was sold an insurance policy maturing in 2124. The case sounds bizarre. But instances of mis-selling like this are painfully common across the country. The bank resolved the matter after a viral social media post. The harder question is why blaming the bank alone is not enough.

Sensex sinks over 500 points, Nifty tumbles as AI panic sinks IT stocksThe benchmark BSE Sensex fell 559 points to close at 85,674.92, while the Nifty 50 slipped below the psychologically important 25,900 mark.

Aviation body writes to government as it bids to tighten cabin crew fatigue ruleThe Federation of Indian Airlines (FIA) has asked the government to dilute parts of the draft rules. The industry body represents IndiGo and Air India, and has raised concerns that the changes may create operational and cost pressures.

IT stocks crack under global AI pressure. Is this a buying chance?The Nifty IT index fell 4.67% by 12 PM, hitting a four-month low. The selloff wiped out nearly Rs 1.3 lakh crore in combined market value in a single session. The IT pack on the Sensex was also down nearly 5%.

Inflation data reset: Why your groceries will matter less than your rentOnion or tomato prices will no longer dominate inflation headlines. With rent and services gaining weight, the new data reset could quietly shape your EMIs, savings returns and everyday financial decisions. Read on to understand what has changed and why it matters for your wallet.

Gold, silver cool off after sharp correction. Is it a good chance to buy?Gold and silver have corrected sharply after record highs. Is this the right time to buy or a warning sign? Here is a simple breakdown of what it means for you.

India-US trade deal to benefit local industries: New Delhi envoy to WashingtonIndian ambassador to the United States, Vinay Kwatra, in an exclusive interview with India Today, said that the newly-reached trade deal between India and the US will benefit the two nations.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro tumble up to 5%: Why are IT stocks falling today?From US jobs data to mounting AI disruption fears, here is a clear breakdown of what triggered today's IT sell-off and what investors should watch next.
Sensex down 500 points: Why is stock market falling today?The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 515.63 points to 83,718.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 132.85 points to 25,821.00 as of 11:39 am.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks tank over global selloff; Infosys down 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 360.77 points to 83,872.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 99.70 points to 25,854.15 as of 9:21 am.

RBI finally takes note of mis-selling, banks to refund if complaint is provedOver the past few years, concerns have been raised about customers being pushed into buying insurance, mutual funds or other third-party products without fully understanding them.

Rolls-Royce CEO meets PM in Delhi, discusses plans to scale up India opsRolls-Royce CEO Tufan Erginbilgic met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi to discuss plans to substantially expand the British engineering giant's operations in India in line with the government's Viksit Bharat vision.

UBS to hire 3,000 roles in India as Credit Suisse takeover triggers Swiss job cutsUBS bought Credit Suisse in a state-engineered rescue in 2023, leaving it as Switzerland's sole major banking group. It has said around 3,000 Swiss jobs will be cut, most likely later this year.

Gold, silver or Bitcoin? Will crypto steal the spotlightGold and silver have long been seen as safe havens for investors, a reliable store of value in uncertain times. But with the rise of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, the question on everyone's mind is: could cryptos steal the spotlight?

Pace and ease of doing business drive Tamil Nadu's edge, says TRB RajaaRajaa said that investors value policy continuity as much as fresh reforms, noting that Tamil Nadu has built trust by maintaining stable, industry-friendly rules across political regimes. He added that this continuity has strengthened global investor confidence in the state.

entertainment.headline: Dhurandhar's pirated DVD being sold in Pakistan for Rs 16, viral video surfaces Pirated versions of Dhurandhar are being sold in Pakistan at low prices, even though the film is officially banned there. A video showing the same is now going viral on social media.

Anurag Kashyap says Kohrra 2 made him weep; calls performances cathartic Kohrra Season 2 has deeply moved filmmaker Anurag Kashyap. He praised its patient storytelling and cathartic performances by Mona Singh and Barun Sobti.

O' Romeo box office Day 1 prediction: Steady opening for Shahid's Valentine film Early box office trends for O' Romeo suggest a steady opening at the ticket window. The film relies on the Valentine's Day weekend to attract audiences.

Crime 101 review: Chris Hemsworth, Mark Ruffalo anchor a slick old-school thrillerRelease Date:Fri Feb 13, 2026 Crime 101 movie review: Crime 101 is a polished thriller set against Los Angeles' sunlit menace. The film explores crime and morality through strong performances and classic noir style.

Sunny Deol credits Border 2 success to blessings of his late father Dharmendra At the Border 2 success press conference, Sunny Deol expressed his thanks to fans, reflected on his recent career achievements, and spoke about the role of his late father Dharmendra in his journey.

O' Romeo: Sutapa Sikdar recalls Irrfan, Sapna Didi in note to Vishal Bhardwaj Sutapa Sikdar, wife of the late Irrfan Khan, extended her heartfelt wishes to Vishal Bhardwaj as O' Romeo hits the screens today. The director had previously imagined the film with Irrfan in the lead role.

Bandwaale review: A tale of poetry and passion that loses its rhythmRelease Date:Fri Feb 13, 2026 Bandwaale review: Bandwaale attempts to tell a heartfelt story about dreams, artistic freedom, and small-town pressures but falters due to scattered storytelling and predictable tropes.

Tu Yaa Main Review: Shanaya-Adarsh Gourav's thriller bites when you least expect itRelease Date:Fri Feb 13, 2026 Tu Yaa Main movie review: Tu Yaa Main is a gripping thriller that fuses modern romance with edge-of-your-seat survival drama in Mumbai. With strong performances and a twist-filled story, it keeps you hooked, capturing fear, trust, and high-stakes tension in every scene.

Ram Charan, Upasana name twins Shivram and Anveera Devi, explain meaning Ram Charan and Upasana Konidela have announced the names of their newborn twins, Shivram and Anveera Devi, following a traditional naming ceremony that reflected both cultural significance and family involvement.

Funky matters: Why the film is important for Vishwak Sen and director KV Anudeep An unusual collaboration brings together a director trying to prove his consistency and an actor searching for momentum, making Funky a crucial film for both KV Anudeep and Vishwak Sen.

Farhan Akhtar to play Pandit Ravi Shankar in Sam Mendes' Beatles saga Farhan Akhtar is set for his Hollywood acting debut as Ravi Shankar in Sam Mendes' four-part cinematic event about The Beatles. The announcement coincides with ongoing developments surrounding the film Don 3.

Zeenat Aman reflects on ageing, admits she'd 'rot in bed' without work Zeenat Aman opened up about ageing at 74 and shared why work still gives her purpose, peace of mind and something to look forward to. The veteran actor also joked about what she'd do if projects ever dried up.

Adrian Lester on working with Game of Thrones actor Emilia Clarke in Ponies Actor Adrian Lester opened up about working with Emilia Clarke in Cold War spy series Ponies, and what made her process stand out. He also talked about the show's fresh tone, strong writing, and why the series feels different from typical spy dramas.

Yash's Toxic shouldn't be judged by teaser, says KFCC president Jayamala Karnataka Film Chamber of Commerce president Dr. Jayamala has called for restraint and highlighted the importance of waiting for censor board review before forming opinions amid Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups row.

Ahead of O'Romeo, Vishal Bhardwaj writes of his capacity for love and violence Director Vishal Bhardwaj expressed great pride and gratitude ahead of O' Romeo's theatrical release. In an emotional note, the filmmaker shared personal insights behind the making of the film and acknowledged the dedication of his team.

Director Abishan, Soundarya Rajinikanth to team up again after With Love success After the recent success of With Love, Abishan Jeevinth shares plans for a new project with the film's producers, as the team celebrates positive reviews and strong box office performance.

Priyanka Chopra confirms Citadel Season 2, but the future looks uncertain Priyanka Chopra Jonas confirmed Citadel Season 2 is in development, but admitted she has no clarity on the franchise's future. The spy series continues despite mixed reviews, high costs and cancelled global spin-offs.

Actor Aisha Sharma turns author: Hope the book finds you when you need it most Aisha Sharma is set to release her debut book, Bloom, featuring one hundred meditative reflections on self-love and strength. Drawing from personal experiences, the actor aims to offer reassurance to those facing burnout, encouraging readers to trust their inner compass and embrace vulnerability.

Katie Holmes mourns Dawson's Creek co-star James Van Der Beek: He is beloved Katie Holmes shared an emotional tribute for her Dawson's Creek co-star James Van Der Beek, who died following a colorectal cancer diagnosis. She praised his bravery and selflessness, expressing deep gratitude for their journey together while offering love to his wife and children.

general news.headline: India will back democratic Bangladesh: PM congratulates Tarique Rahman for winWith the BNP crossing the halfway mark in the Bangladesh national elections, PM Modi took to X and extended warm wishes to Tarique Rehman, signalling continued support for a democratic transition after the interim Yunus administration.

BNP set for landslide win in Bangladesh, to form government after 20 yearsThe BNP's performance placed it beyond the 151-seat threshold required for a simple majority, putting the party in a strong position to form the next government. While vote counting continued in several constituencies, overall trends suggested little room for major changes in the final tally.

Left red-faced, Pak contacted US after trade deal post showed India map with POKPakistan said it contacted the United States after a US Trade Representative map incorrectly showed Pakistan-occupied Kashmir and Aksai Chin within Indian territory, after which Washington deleted the post.

When told about shutdown, Claude AI was ready to blackmail and murder engineerCall it smart. Or dangerous. Anthropic has again confirmed that its Claude AI can veer off the rails, like it once did when it was ready to blackmail and even harm an engineer to avoid shutdown.

SOS call from spouse for money? Having a passphrase can save your life's earningsWith scammers using AI tech to mimic the voices of partners and family members to swindle life's earnings, a passphrase should be the perfect Valentine's Day gift. This is how a simple pre-decided passphrase can save people from being swindled when it is difficult to tell real voices from AI-generated ones.

Live: BNP inches towards landmark victory, official results soonBangladesh General Election Live Updates: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) under the leadership of Tarique Rahman is all set for a landslide victory in the recently concluded 13th general election of Bangladesh. The BNP and its allies have secured 209 seats and have crossed the two-thirds majority mark. Rahman himself has secured victory in two constituencies. The election has proved to be a disappointment for Jamaat-E-Islami and its allies, which have secured only 62 seats till now. The counting is underway, and for live updates, follow indiatoday.in.

The weakness was not driven by any one company-specific announcement. Instead, it reflects a mix of global triggers and rising uncertainty around how artificial intelligence will reshape the industry.

PMO gets new address today, Prime Minister to unveil Rs 100 commemorative coinIn a transformative milestone for India's administrative governance architecture, the Prime Minister's Office will get a new address today for the first time since Independence.

When an astronaut smuggled a club and played golf on the MoonAlan Shepard's playful experiment captured something equally important about exploration: the unmistakably human urge to improvise, joke, and celebrate achievement, even 3,80,000 kilometers from Earth.
The AI job debate: Alarm, optimism, and the real threatWill the arrival of AI result in a job crisis? Most predictions suggest May Day for entry level jobs across all fields.

Cricket nerd from 6, Gerhard Erasmus lives up to the Namibian spirit in KotlaICC T20 World Cup, India vs Namibia: Gerhard Erasmus walked the talk for Namibia at the Arun Jaitley Stadium on Thursday. He registered his best ever figures in T20Is, but was not able to take his team over the line against India.

Kerala woman blocks scooter rider from using footpath by placing foot in frontIn the now-viral video, the woman is seen walking along the footpath when the man attempts to ride through the pedestrian space to escape a traffic jam on the busy road.

When will Skyroot launch India's first private Vikram-I rocket?Senior officials at the company said the team is currently focused on flight-readiness checks of Vikram-I's integrated avionics and flight-algorithm systems at Skyroot's testing facilities.

Microsoft AI boss says AI will replace most white-collar jobs in 12 monthsMicrosoft AI chief Mustafa Suleyman believes that AI could replace most white collar jobs including lawyers, accountants and more, within the next year. His comments come days after Anthropic's Claude Cowork shook the stocks of SaaS companies.

Incorrect, speculative: India on Italian report blaming pilot for Air India crashThe Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau said the investigation is still ongoing, no final conclusions have been reached, and unverified reporting risks causing public anxiety and undermining the integrity of the process.

Ishan Kishan explainsT20 World Cup 2026: India's wicketkeeper-batter, Ishan Kishan, and mystery spinner explain how they prepare for the bowlers they are going to face. They are set to face Pakistan next and will be up against the mystery-spinner, Usman Tariq for the first time.

Imran Khan's son claims father almost blind in one eye, blames Munir, his puppetsKasim Khan accused the Pakistan government and military leadership of causing his father, Imran Khan's, severe vision loss through prolonged solitary confinement and alleged medical neglect.

SpaceX Crew-12 launch: Four astronauts to fly to Space Station todaySpaceX is set to launch the Crew 12 mission to the International Space Station today at 3:45 pm IST. Learn how to watch the Falcon 9 rocket carry four astronauts into orbit.

A slice of history: How a pizza-maker spun Italy to first T20 World Cup winCrishan Kalugamage once feared his cricket dream had ended in Italy's pizzerias. On Thursday, the leg-spinner delivered a spell for the ages, powering Italy to a landmark T20 World Cup win over Nepal at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Here's his story.

Bihar woman's Rose Day celebration with husband invites FIR, police raidBihar woman Kanchan Devi's Rose Day celebration with her husband, wherein he gave him roses and a bottle of wine, has landed her in legal trouble, considering alcohol is banned in the eastern state.

I'll be visiting President Xi Jinping in April: Donald Trump confirms meetingDonald Trump said that he will visit China in April to meet Xi Jinping, with the Chinese premier expected to arrive in Washington later this year, amid a fragile post-trade war truce.

India reviewing US invite to join Trump's Gaza Board of Peace, Govt confirmsAddressing reporters in New Delhi, MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal confirmed that New Delhi has received a formal communication from Washington regarding participation in the board but is yet to take a position.

sports.headline: Riyan Parag set to be named Rajasthan Royals captain: Report IPL 2026: Rajasthan Royals have reportedly decided to make Riyan Parag the captain of the franchise. The move comes after the exit of Sanju Samson from the Jaipur-based team.

Italy's first T20 World Cup win left some guys with tears in eyes: Coach Davison T20 World Cup: Italy head coach John Davison revealed that emotions ran high in the camp, with players left in tears after scripting their first-ever World Cup win by triumphing over Nepal on February 12.

IND vs PAK will be special, but not worrying too much: Ishan Kishan ready for Feb 15 T20 World Cup: India batter Ishan Kishan emphasised how their upcoming clash against arch rivals Pakistan on February 15 will be a special one, but the team is not fretting too much on the fixture preparing for it like any other game.

USA batter calls out ICC over lesser funding for associate nations T20 World Cup: USA batter Shayan Jahangir has urged the ICC to increase funding and exposure for Associate nations ahead of their must-win clash against the Netherlands in Chennai. He believes better support will help emerging teams thrive globally.

On Thursday, the leg-spinner delivered a spell for the ages, powering Italy to a landmark T20 World Cup win over Nepal at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Here's his story.

Matchday Preview: Injury-hit Australia eye successive wins to strengthen Super 8 berth Day 6 of the T20 World Cup features three key matches, with Australia vs Zimbabwe, Canada vs UAE, and Netherlands vs USA promising high-octane action in the global tournament.

Watch: Arshdeep Singh shares first glimpse of Abhishek Sharma after stomach illness T20 World Cup: Arshdeep Singh's latest social media video offered a glimpse of opener Abhishek Sharma as India await clarity on his fitness ahead of the Pakistan clash on February 15. The opener is recovering from a stomach bug.

Asked about PAK spin attack, Varun Chakravarthy throws verbal googly at Parthiv Varun Chakravarthy expresses confidence in India's spin attack ahead of the T20 World Cup clash with Pakistan. The match carries high stakes as Pakistan seeks to end their losing streak against India.

India must crack spin code before Pakistan twist the knife in Colombo T20 World Cup 2026: India's unbeaten start hides a spin concern ahead of the Pakistan clash in Colombo, with questions looming against a five-pronged spin attack.

Karnataka clears IPL return to Chinnaswamy stadium with strict safety conditionsKarnataka cabinet clears IPL return to Chinnaswamy Stadium with 35,000 crowd cap and strict safety measures after Cunha report, months after tragic stampede halted cricket in Bengaluru.

How are India preparing for Pakistan's Usman Tariq? Ishan Kishan explainsT20 World Cup 2026: India's wicketkeeper-batter, Ishan Kishan, and mystery spinner explain how they prepare for the bowlers they are going to face. They are set to face Pakistan next and will be up against the mystery-spinner, Usman Tariq for the first time.

India crush Namibia in Delhi but spin woes remain ahead of Pakistan clashIndia secured their biggest victory in T20 World Cup history, beating Namibia by 93 runs at Arun Jaitely Stadium in Delhi. The win extended India's unbeaten streak to 11 matches in the tournament but exposed vulnerabilities against spin bowling ahead of the all-important clash against Pakistan.

Cricket on page 1? Italy coach hopes T20 World Cup win knocks off Winter OlympicsT20 World Cup 2026: Italy achieved its first-ever T20 World Cup victory with a dominant win over Nepal in Mumbai. The landmark result could spark greater interest in cricket amidst Italy's Winter Olympics dominance.

Prep for Pakistan? Gerhard Erasmus gives India a taste of Usman Tariq's unorthodoxyIND vs NAM, T20 World Cup: Gerhard Erasmus' unorthodox spell stalled India's pursuit of a 250-plus total in Delhi, but his variations may have offered a timely preview of the sterner spin examination awaiting them against Pakistan and much-talked-about Usman Tariq in Colombo on Sunday.

Hardik Pandya's Delhi fireworks ends after Namibian player's sensational catchHardik Pandya scored a brilliant 52 before being caught out by a stunning boundary catch from Dylan Leicher. The catch shifted momentum as Namibia's Gerhard Erasmus ran through India's middle order.

DDCA breaks silence on soft drink vendor's viral video from Arun Jaitley StadiumDDCA responded to a viral video alleging vendors reusing already-poured soft drinks for resale at Arun Jaitley Stadium. The video had gone viral on social media, sparking widespread concerns for fans.

Sanju Samson dazzles briefly, but misses golden opportunity against NamibiaT20 World Cup, IND vs NAM: Sanju Samson scored 22 runs off eight balls against Namibia but missed a golden opportunity to convert his start into a big score at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

Virat Kohli returns to India in fun mood, fans turn airport into selfie festivalVirat Kohli returned to India after a month in London, and was greeted by enthusiastic fans. Kohli has been out of action in the ODI series against New Zealand and will be next seen playing in the Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026).
Popularity follows stars of Afghanistan, Nepal, USA in T20 World CupFrom Gurbaz to Lokesh, every thrilling on-field performance by underdogs has been rewarded with popularity on social media.

No Abhishek Sharma for IND vs PAK game, hints captain Suryakumar YadavT20 World Cup 2026: Abhishek Sharma missed India's game against Namibia in New Delhi due to a stomach-related illness. Captain Suryakumar Yadav hinted at the posssibility of the World No. 1 T20I batter missing the game against Pakistan on Sunday in Colombo.

Pizza triumphs over momo: Italy's historic win in T20 World Cup sparks frenzyT20 World Cup: Italy registered a historic win in their maiden T20 World Cup, beating Nepal by ten wickets at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

Benvuento Italy: Azurri make World Cup history, stun Nepal at WankhedeT20 World Cup, NEP vs Italy: Italy lit up Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai, defeating Nepal by 10 wickets and chasing down 124 with 44 balls to spare, securing their maiden victory in the history of the tournament.

Boycott 2.0? Afghanistan players withdraw from PSL auction after Pakistan's backlashAfghanistan players pull out of PSL auction in third major boycott controversy to hit South Asian cricket in weeks, following similar political fallout over Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit.

Why IPL 2026 schedule is yet to be released? BCCI breaks silenceThe BCCI hasn't yet released the schedule for IPL 2026, set to run from March 26 to May 31. The delay is attributed to potential clashes with upcoming Assembly elections in West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, and Assam, which could affect security arrangements and venue availability.

IND vs NAM Highlights: India hammer Namibia by 93 runs to warm-up for Pakistan clashIndia (IND) vs Namibia (NAM) Highlights, T20 World Cup: India beat Namibia by 93 runs in New Delhi and went to the top of Group A. Ishan Kishan scored a fifty after which Varun Chakravarthy's three-wicket haul blew Namibia away.

Sanju Samson misses out? Ex-cricketer floats left-field Abhishek Sharma replacementT20 World Cup 2026: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel suggests promoting Washington Sundar as opener in Abhishek Sharma's absence for India's February 12 match against Namibia. Sanju Samson, however, is likely to partner Ishan Kishan at the top.

Drafted as Australia's T20 World Cup cover, Steve Smith scripts PSL historySteve Smith set a new record as PSL's most expensive player after being signed by the Sialkot Stallions for PKR 14 crore in the league's first ever auction. PSL 11 will feature two new franchises, Sialkot and Hyderabad, and a change from draft to auction format, as over 100 players secured contracts ahead of the season starting March 26.

Federer still the box office GOAT: Hall of Fame tickets sold out in 120 secondsIs Roger Federer the best-selling tennis player of all time? Tickets for his Hall of Fame induction ceremony sold out in just 2 minutes. This happened despite the organisation adding more tickets for the event.

After argument during SA vs AFG, Mohammad Nabi fined for code of conduct breachMohammad Nabi was fined 15 percent of his match fee and given one demerit point after an argument with the umpires during Afghanistan's T20 World Cup 2026 Group D clash against South Africa in Ahmedabad. Nabi admitted his offence and accepted the sanction.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
